application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
description:
The Developer Relations organization helps keep us connected to the communities that love technology as much as we do. Our focus is on supporting third party developers who build applications and businesses on Google's platforms. Developer Advocates act as passionate advocates for Google technologies, and are vocal champions for developer interests within Google. This is a position for engineers who love connecting with developers and speaking publicly about cutting-edge technologies on conference panels, at user groups, on blogs and with the press. You also communicate internally with Product Managers. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5, as well as our core G Suite and Ads APIs, are just some of the platforms you promote and support. Your work fosters a community of developers working with Google technologies and helps to drive strategy around Developer Relations.

As a Developer Advocate, you will help accelerate Android's developer ecosystem, improve app and SDK quality, partner upstream with Android product and engineering to deliver great products to developers. You’ll play a key role in shaping how we bring new Android capabilities to developers, while partnering with teams across Android to advocate the needs of developers, driving our strategy, narratives, best practices, events and outreach for Android developers globally.

A key priority for the team is the annual release and developer preview. You’ll dive deep with Product and Engineering on features, impact assessments and launch needs. You’ll also work with third-party and first-party app teams as well as original equipment manufactorer (OEM) facing teams to collect feedback, build support channels and drive early compatibility and adoption.

In this role, you will help expand our support for third-party SDK and library developers on Android. You’ll work with teams across Android and Play to ensure SDK quality, improve workflows and build tools to understand SDK performance. You’ll help drive the technical strategy and scale the program to developers worldwide. Additionally, you will shape the developer strategy for strategic initiatives such as privacy, security, connectivity, design, tools and others. Since developer needs vary by region, you’ll advocate those during product design and organize tailored regional outreach.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience as a technology advocate in mobile app/game development, tools and APIs development or SDK/library projects.
  • 3 years of experience in software engineering, product management or developer relations.
  • Experience in programming for Android, Java or Kotlin applications.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience creating compelling overviews, product requirements documents (PRD)/specs and executive-level presentations.
  • Ability to influence and communicate cross-functionally and across teams.
  • Ability to take initiative, innovate and experiment.
  • Excellent planning, structuring and organization skills.
  • Excellent analytical skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Drive developer strategy for platform and product releases, partnering with Product Management, Engineering, PR, Marketing, Business Development and other teams.
  • Participate in technical and design discussions with teams across Android to advocate for developer needs.
  • Advocate technical best practices that improve quality, compatibility, security and privacy across apps and SDKs.
  • Build developer narratives, communications and outreach materials, such as code samples, blog posts, documents, videos, presentations and internal communications.
  • Meet developers inside and outside Google to gain insights on current issues, trends and opportunities. Expand feedback through events, developer interviews, communities, videos, research and market intelligence.
title: Developer Advocate, Developer Initiatives, Android Devrel
